title: Sergio Aguero denied penalty for Manchester City, and Steven Gerrard and Rio Ferdinand can’t believe it
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments STEVEN GERRARD and Rio Ferdinand were stunned Manchester City were not awarded a penalty in the first half at the Etihad. 
Sergio Aguero went down under the challenge of goalkeeper Daniel Subasic, but was booked for diving by the referee. BT Sport 4 Rio Ferdinand and Steven Gerrard were in the BT Sport studio for the Man City game 
Manchester City players were incensed at the decision, and so too was manager Pep Guardiola in the dugout. 
“It’s a blatant penalty,” Gerrard said on BT Sport. 
“It’s a clear foul, he wipes him out and City were very unlucky not to get a penalty.” RELATED ARTICLES EURO CLASH LIVE - Man City 3 Monaco 3: Sergio Aguero volleys City level again in stunning end-to-end tie at the Etihad In for the Kyl Everything you need to know about Monaco's Kylian Mbappe... who is dubbed the 'next Thierry Henry' Emptyhad Fans mock Manchester City's dreadful attendance for the Champions League clash with Monaco EXIT DOOR OPENS Man Utd's Daley Blind set for summer exit as boss Jose Mourinho eyes Benfica's Victor Lindelof Preview What time does Bayer Leverkusen vs Atletico Madrid in the Champions League kick off and what TV channel is it on? Getty Images Sergio Aguero tried to round the onrushing Daniel Subasic Getty Images The Argentine striker goes down under the challenge of the goalkeeper Getty Images Aguero falls to the floor after a challenge from the Monaco goalkeeper 
The incident happened with the match poised at 1-1 after goals from Raheem Sterling and Radamel Falcao. 
Ferdinand added: “Pep is rightly so going bananas because that was a pen.” AS Monaco fans take over Manchester City centre ahead of Champions League tie
